title: Madras curry powder

preparations.content: Place curry leaves into mixing bowl and roast <b>1 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Add chillies and peppercorns and roast <b>20 sec/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Add coriander, cumin, fenugreek, fennel, mustard seeds and allspice berries and roast <b>1 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Allow to cool for 5 minutes in mixing bowl.
Add turmeric and salt and mill <b>30 sec/speed 10<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mill for a further <b>30 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer into a sealable storage jar or container until ready to use (see Tips).

hintsAndTricks: Store Madras curry powder in a sealable storage container in a cool, dark place for up to 6 months.
Some spices roast faster than others; by adding them at different times it avoids burning the spices (which could result in a bitter taste).
